description: Interaction table for polarity logic invariants with Θ, Σ, Π, and basic logic gates.

entries.effect: AND gate must propagate a polarity sign computed from its inputs; output Θ cannot be dropped.
entries.nf\_condition: Output polarity is Θ(a) ⊕ Θ(b) or another declared aggregation rule.

entries.effect: OR gate must maintain a well-defined polarity aggregation; no silent polarity reset to neutral.
entries.nf\_condition: Output Θ is derived from input signs and gate semantics.

entries.effect: NOT acts as an explicit sign-flip operator on Θ; any sign flip must be mediated by such an operator.
Θ+ channels should preferentially evaluate to Π \= ⊤ unless a contradiction or explicit negation is present.
entries.nf\_condition: If Θ(x) \= '+', then Π(x) \= ⊤ or a contradiction flag must be set.

entries.effect: Θ- channels must not evaluate to Π \= ⊤ without explicit negation or contradiction witness.
entries.nf\_condition: If Θ(x) \= '-', then Π(x) \= ⊥ unless a negation operator is present.
